sub_title: Close Protection Officer  bij United Nations assistance mission Afghanistan
summary:
Excellent knowledge of guarding and security operations, combined with a solid background of military, police or other security specialization (UN security).

To understand and consolidate the varying specialization such as electronics, communications, mechanics, weapons and other sophisticated devices encountered in premises security operations; ability to deal with stress factors when encountered.

Works collaboratively with colleagues to achieve Unit/Section goals.

profile_positions.title: Close Protection Officer

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities/Duties.
•Act as a Protection Officer and/or Protection Focal Point/ Security Driver in the performance of assigned duties, as required. •Gathering and analysing information for the preparation of risk and threat assessments as it pertains to the security and safety of the UN VIP’s/principal(s). . • To understand and consolidate the varying specialization such as electronics, communications, mechanics, weapons and other sophisticated devices encountered in premises security operations; ability to deal with stress factors when encountered.
•Conduct security surveys of offices, residences  and other mission facilities. •Liaises with relevant civil police, military, law enforcement and other officials as necessary. •Upon instruction, establishes and deploys tactically trained protection teams to meet the assessed level of threat•Assists in the coordination and execution of operational procedures and practices in line with established policy, standards, and procedures. •Aides in the identification and training of Protection Officers (PO) from within existing resources. •Keep updates on a continuous basis of all movements and unusual incidents involving the UN VIP’s/principal(s).
profile_positions.title: Deputy Team Leader Close Protection Unit

profile_positions.description:
Description of Your Duties:

•	International experience in security teams serving a multicultural community with 900+ staff, utilizing two main buildings in The Netherlands and four field offices.
•	Working in a high security environment in a legal organization tasked with investigating, prosecuting and trails of persons accused of serious international crimes. The environment required a good situational awareness and a high level of professionalism. 
•	Providing armed security service and 100% access screening of people and goods. 
•	Experience of shift work conditions and providing additional security during events and missions.
•	Providing security in a court environment, including escorting and transferring high-profile detainees (senior military and political figures), witnesses, often with strong media presence and public interest in the trails.
•	Providing close protection for a long range of clients including staff members, Judges and VIP’s.
•	Intensive training programme within the UN emphasises, continuous learning, including regular tactical weapons training, first aid, emergency response incident crises management training etc.
•	Training in communications / presentations.
•	Experienced working in English in a multicultural team.
•	Advanced security and law-enforcement skills, including close protection.
•	Providing security at international high level UN conferences. 
•	Experience in long term field missions.
profile_positions.title: Security Officer - CP officer

profile_positions.description:
Description of Your Duties:

As a Pathfinder I was a part of the brigade's staff support company. The pathfinders are brigade recces and specialists in reconnaissance and marking of drop zones and landing zones for helicopters and paratroopers. They are also able to operate for Tactical Air Landing Operations and operate in small squads of 6 men. Their deployment can be by parachute, airplane or helicopter (fast rope). I have an extensive military background which includes highly specialized courses.

Recruiter: 
Seek out, interview, and test applicants to locate qualified employees for job openings for Royal Netherlands Army. Travel to universities and colleges to interview promising students for employment. Evaluate applicants on their technical skills, education, work history, personality and managerial abilities for the Royal Dutch Army Academy as well for the Royal Dutch Army School. Inform candidates of Army benefits and job opportunities by giving promotional presentations. Checking applicant’s references. Therefore i frequently worked on weekends and in the evenings and am required to understand and implement the Army guidelines. Also i must have excellent knowledge how to use audio-visual equipment and other office equipment, including computers and having good communications skills and an interest in people.

Administrator:
Recoverability - Creating and testing Backups 
Integrity - Verifying or helping to verify data integrity 
Security - Defining and/or implementing access controls to the data 
Performance - Ensuring maximum performance given budgetary constraints 

Section account manager:
Type and word-process various documents and electronic information. Create financial and statistical tools and reports using spread sheets. Manage, organise, and update relevant data using database applications. Communicate and provide information by relevant methods internally and externally to assist and enable organizational operations
profile_positions.title: Full Corparol, 11th Air Assault Division
